intro: Schrankia confusa, commonly known as the Florida skunk vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the summer. Schrankia confusa is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for various pollinators and its ecological importance in wetland ecosystems.
